attributes.action: We call on all MPs to vote for a dissolution of Parliament and General Election.
attributes.additional_details:
The result of the EU referendum was unexpected by the main political parties. The 'Leave' campaign included many contradictory aims, being composed of factions across the political spectrum. As a result, there is no clear plan for the future of the UK.

By holding a general election, the alternative views for the way forward can be tested and validated by the UK electorate. The resulting government would have a clear mandate to implement their plan as part of the negotiations with the EU.
attributes.background:
None of the main parties campaigned for a "Leave" vote and a majority of current MPs do not support "Brexit".
By holding a general election, the alternative plans for a future UK can be tested. A new government would be mandated with a coherent plan for the UK's exit from the EU.
